pilectric.motor_control package¶

Submodules¶

pilectric.motor_control.stepper module¶

This module contains stepper motor controls.

class pilectric.motor_control.stepper.StepperMotorController(step_pin, direction_pin, microstep_pins=(), microsteps=1, pi_connection=None)[source]¶

Bases: pilectric.gpio_controller.GPIOController

Base class for control of stepper motors.

FULL_STEPS_PER_TURN = None¶
MICROSTEPS = {}¶
clockwise¶

bool: True if motor set to rotate clockwise, False if counterclockwise.

microsteps¶

int: The number of microsteps to take.

move_at_speed_for_time(speed, seconds)[source]¶

Move the motor a number of degrees in a period of time.

Args:
speed (float): Speed in degrees/second to move at. time (float): Time to move the motor for in seconds.
move_by_angle_at_speed(angle, speed)[source]¶

Move the motor a number of degrees at a speed.

Args:
angle (float): Number of degrees to move. speed (float): Speed in degrees/second to move at.
move_by_angle_in_time(angle, seconds)[source]¶

Move the motor a number of degrees in a period of time.

Args:
angle (float): Number of degrees to move. time (float): Time in which to move the motor by degrees.
step(num_steps, step_delay=0.0005)[source]¶

Step the motor a number of times.

Args:
num_steps (int): Number of steps to perform.
Keyword Args:
step_delay (float):
The time for which the pulse is high. Therefore one step will take 2 * step_delay seconds.
class pilectric.motor_control.stepper.TMC2209(step_pin, direction_pin, enable_pin, microstep_pins=(), microsteps=8)[source]¶

Bases: pilectric.motor_control.stepper.StepperMotorController

Control a stepper motor using a TMC2209 v1.2 control board

FULL_STEPS_PER_TURN = 200¶
MICROSTEPS = {8: (False, False), 16: (True, True), 32: (False, True), 64: (True, False)}¶
